page.title: 11Easton Lodge
page.content:
Owner: Mr. Rampton
The house dates back to{1606}with extensions added in{1840.}Mr Rampton bought the house in{1963}with 493 acres of land which consisted of {Pasture 150 acres, Arable 145 acres, {and woodland 147 acres. Honingham}and {Taverham}farms were purchased adding a further{1515 acres}of land on the estate. From that time he built up his estate to it's present{2500 acre}size, 600 acres of which is woodland which contains all type of trees. The house overlooks the river{Tudd}which flows through the grounds. He lets{9}houses, mostly for his workers, his employees include{5 men working on the land, 3 {men working with the pigs, 1 man in {the woods, 1 gardener and 1 {gamekeeper.}His workforce has shrunk rapidly since 1975-75% being sacked.
